content: Which 19th-century English author wrote "Pride and Prejudice" and is renowned for her social commentary in novels?

The 19th-century English author who wrote "Pride and Prejudice" and is renowned for her social commentary in novels is Jane Austen. Born in 1775, Austen is widely recognized as one of the most influential novelists in English literature, particularly known for her insightful portrayals of middle-class life and her sharp wit and irony in exploring themes of love, morality, and social class. "Pride and Prejudice," published in 1813, is perhaps her most famous work, which continues to captivate readers with its timeless exploration of human relationships and societal norms.
